monogr.title: Epistles. The third and last volume : containing two decades by Ioseph Hall
monogr.author: Hall, Joseph

div.head: TO THE MOST HIGH AND EXCELLENT PRINCE, HENRIE, Prince of Wales, all happinesse.
div.p:
LET mee not (whiles I desire to be dutifull) seeme importunate, in my dedications. I now bring to your Highnesse these my last, and perhaps
most materiall Letters: wherein, if I mistake not, (as, how easily are wee deceiued in our owne?) the pleasure of the varietie shall striue with the importance of matter. There is no worldly thing, I confesse, whereof I am more ambitious then of your Highnesses contentment, which that you place in goodnesse, is not more your glory, then our ioy: Do so still, and heauen and earth shall agree to blesse you, and vs in you. For me, after this my officious boldnesse, I shall betake
myselfe in silence, to some greater worke, wherein I may approue my seruice to the Church, and to your Highnes, as her second ioy and care. My heart shall be alwaies, and vpon al opportunities, my tong and pen, shall no lesse gladly bee deuoted to my gracious Master, as one

closer.signed: Who reioyce to be your Highnesses (though vnworthy, yet) faithfull and obsequious Seruant. IOS. HALL.
